text: Cooper Bridge was a railway station built by the Manchester and Leeds Railway to serve the town of Huddersfield in West Yorkshire, England. ==History== Opened by the Manchester and Leeds Railway in 1840 to serve Huddersfield, away, which at that time did not have a station of its own. The station was said to have been built for and by, the owner of Kirklees Hall the Armytage family.Calderdale Companion - Cooper Bridge stationMalcolm Bull's Calderdale Companion - Photo of station platform ==References== ==External links== * Cooper Bridge station on navigable 1947 O.
